intro: Corydalis qilianshanica, commonly known as the Qilian mountain corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped tubers underground, which serve as storage organs for nutrients. Its leaves are basal and trifoliate, with three leaflets arranged in a palmate pattern. Corydalis qilianshanica is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
